text:
from: Alabama ETV Commission
add two
Primarily his unit heard from those who have originated this type
of program in his studio. Participants included George Patterson,
Director Internal Revenue; Britt Thompson, President, Alabama Arch¬
eological Society; Clark Stallworth, Newspaper Editor, Birmingham
Post Herald; Robert Renwick, Better Business Bureau Manager; Mrs.
Virginia Temple, AAUW Officer; Parks Scott, Southern Bel Richard
Evans, Director Special Affairs, University of Alabama, Birmingahm
Extension Center; Miss Nell Peerson, Director, Alabama Literacy
Project; Mr. Leslie J. Waller, Supervisor, Physical Restoration, Vocational
Rehabi1itat ion.
The engineering members were given intensified lectures under
supervision of Al Renfro, Chief Engineer/Alabama ETV Commission.
The program included "Basic Principles and Use of Different Types of
Image Orthicon Tubes”, Joe Jepsky, G.E., "Closed Circuit TV for
Educational Purposes”, A.E. Kushner, Jerrold Electronics, "Principles
of the Inch I.O. Camera and Tube", John Wentworth, RCA, "A New
Vertical Interval Switcher for Broadcast", Richard Swann, Sarkes-Tarzian,
and "Performance of the Pre-Set Video-Audio Cross-bar Switcher",
William Boehme.
The Conference offered attendee’s wives and families a three hour
tour to area historic spots and gardens.
The event closed with a Cafe Expresso party where studio talent
from each state "preformed" under direction of Evelyn Walker, Birmingham
public schools TV producer.
